page.title: 10LONGSTANTON VILLAGE SCHOOL
page.content: The{old National school}of 1848 served the village until the late 1940's, when the arrival of RAF families brought many new children to the area. Before long Infant children filled both rooms of the old school, and the Juniors were taught in a hut on the Airfield. In 1953 the{present school in {Hatton Park}opened with 4 classrooms, but already the population had outgrown it and one class had to stay in the old school. Over the next 10 years 5 more classrooms and a second hall were added _ with the result that the school is now very adequate for the 211 children attending it. Indeed, we consider our classrooms the equal of any around, and our grounds, play areas, the animal enclosure and pond, quite unsurpassed anywhere.
